about: Jane Austen was an English novelist known primarily for her six novels, which implicitly interpret, critique, and comment upon the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century. Austen's plots often explore the dependence of women on marriage for the pursuit of favourable social standing and economic security.

name: Jeffery Archer
about: Jeffrey Howard Archer, Baron Archer of Weston-super-Mare is an English novelist, life peer, convicted criminal, and former elected politician who remains a member of the House of Lords

name: J. K. Rowling
about: Joanne Rowling CH OBE FRSL, better known by her pen name J. K. Rowling, is a British author and philanthropist. She wrote Harry Potter, a seven-volume fantasy series published from 1997 to 2007
works: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them
Harry Potter and the Cursed Child
